docs.snippet: Russia's leaders are warning the government will need to make more cutbacks if the nation is to avoid a repeat of the 1998 financial crash, the country's biggest post-Soviet economic trauma....

headline.main: Russia Warns Cuts Needed to Avoid Repeat of '98 Crash

docs.snippet: The Times asked adult readers this same question this week and, now that President Obama has given his final State of the Union address, we pose it to you. What are our biggest problems? What are the most hopeful things about America in 2016?...

headline.main: Student Question | Is America Headed in the Right Direction?

docs.snippet: Jeb Bush says he misjudged the intensity of anger among Republican voters before his White House campaign and believes the country in 2016 is "dramatically different" than in past elections. Yet he insists he's still a viable candidate, and one wh...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeb Bush says he misjudged the intensity of anger among Republican voters before his White House campaign and believes the country in 2016 is "dramatically different" than in past elections. Yet he insists he's still a viable candidate, and one who has broadened his mission to include defending conservativism from GOP front-runner Donald Trump.

headline.main: AP Conversation: Bush Sees Conservatism at Stake in '16
headline.print_headline: AP Conversation: Bush Sees Conservatism at Stake in '16
